page.title: 08Agriculture in Vernham CP
page.content: Agriculture in the area is generally of the mixed variety,ie livestock and cereals. Whilst this may be through choice, it is also dictated by the terrain of the land. The cereals sown include winter barley, wheat, oats and rye. Some of the latter is specifically sown for the local thatcher and is harvested with an old reaper and binder in order to preserve the stalks. The livestock are split 50/50 between sheep and cattle, with the latter split 50/50 between beef rearing and milking. A battery chicken farm is situated at Locks Drove. Shooting of pheasants takes place on most farms.
